description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no 2  (approved plans) and Condition No. 3 (External materials) to allow change the material of the new external windows and doors on third floor from Janisol Arte steel fabricated to PVC, in pursuant to planning permission reference 204851FUL dated 09.03.2021 "Construction of a mansard roof level to accommodate 4 self-contained flats with 8 dormers (front elevation) and 4 dormers and Juliet balconies (rear elevation)."
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of substantive permission 204851FUL dated 09.03.2021.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

Planning Statement (dated May 2022), Design and Access Statement, Site Plan drawing nos.3021/01, Location Plan drawing no.3021/20, Existing drawings nos.3021/02 Rev B (2nd floor plans), Existing Roof Plan drawing no.3021/03, Existing Front Elevation drawing no.3021/04, Existing rear Elevation drawing no. 3021/05,  Existing section AA and BB drawing no.3021/06, Existing section CC and South Elevation drawing no.3021/07, Existing section DD drawing no. 3021/08 and Existing section EE drawing no.3021/09.  Revised Proposed Plans - 3rd Floor Plans drawing nos.3021/11 Rev A, Proposed Roof Plan drawing no.3021/12, Proposed Front Elevation drawing no.3021/13 REV.B, Proposed Rear Elevation drawing no.3021/14 REV.B, Proposed Section AA and BB drawing no.3021/15, Proposed Section CC and South Elevation drawing no.3021/16, Proposed Section DD drawing no.3021/17 and Proposed Section EE drawing no.3021/18
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be as per the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies D1 and D4 of the Publication London Plan 2021; 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013)
| Sufficient cycle parking as per Publication London Plan 2021 standards shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG, Transport Strategy (GLA), policy T5 of the Publication London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

| Provisions to provide adequate refuse and recycling facilities for the proposed development in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and to be fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities and shall be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies S17 and S18 of the Publication London Plan 2021 and National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with  policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the Publication London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and protection of external amenity spaces shall be based on the noise assessment standards specified in SPG10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal room- and external amenity noise levels shall conform with standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies D6 and D14of the Publication London Plan (2021); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, kitchen/living/dining room above/below bedroom of separate dwelling, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies D6 and D14of the Publication London Plan (2021); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.
